commitResults.messageTitle: docs: update PPP and AboutUs
fix: Incorrect Regex for doubles
Add view command
refactor: update Ui layout
commitResults.messageBody:
Ui layout does not match the mock-up of our intended final product.

This makes it hard to visualise command outputs and changes made during
testing.

Let's,
* update Ui layout to be more similar to our mock-up.
* rename the application window to "McKitchen".
* change application icon to our McKitchen design.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: update ViewCommand to reflect changes to Recipe class
docs: update PPP
fix: add missing parseTag/parseTags functions
fix: add whitespace in prefixes
commitResults.messageBody:
The prefix for serving size and steps overlapped when being tokenized
by ArgumentTokenizer.

This caused a bug that throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException when
user tries to use the current serving size prefix.

Let's change the prefixes to include trailing whitespace to resolve
this bug.

PersonListPanel class as well as PersonList fxml files are not
appropriately named.

This inconsistent naming throughout the program files might be
confusing in the future.

Lets rename these files to reference recipes instead.

fix: revert change to ArgumentMultimap::put
commitResults.messageBody:
Temporarily reverting the change as it was causing the AB3 test cases to fail.

This was initially changed so that arguments like ingredients and steps
can be given as one input by using "," as a delimiter. When implementing
that feature (add/edit) we'll have to either modify it for our use later
or add another method specifically for CSV values.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: allowed creation of Ingredient with 2 fields
commitResults.messageBody:
Discussed about the case of "egg 1" and agreed that the quantifier field
should be kept optional. This means that we also remove the valid
quantifier check.

This affects the following apart from Ingredient:
- RecipeBookParserUtil
- JsonAdaptedIngredient

commitResults.messageTitle: test: include more test and refactor test name
commitResults.messageBody:
I have also included a test to ensure that the data in the predicate is
immutable.

As mentioned by Aidan, I've renamed the test to make it easier to
distinguish what the tests do. Building off from his suggestion, I
recommend that the tests methods would be named after the method that we
are testing try not to group tests together (split up equals check and
hashCode check).
